The FAQ posting/welcome message I talked about in my last message should
tell people how to configure their mail agent to not send twelve billion
attachments and 20 lines of font information ...

On Mon, 15 Oct 2001, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Ladies and Gentlemen:
>
> I am frankly quite concerned with the quality of the exchanges going on here
> in the last several weeks. It appears that many people think there are
> "magic formulas" for working with JUnit. As a result, they ask silly
> questions like, "How do I test an EJB with JUnit????" The people who know
> the answer get so tired of writing, "Search this list. Try it. What are you
> having trouble testing?" that they simply stop responding. As a result,
> questions are not being answered.
>
> I would like to ask everyone on this list to ask specific, pointed
> questions, with sample code, if at all possible. Instead of "How to I test
> an EJB????", how about, "I did X, Y and Z to test EJBs using JUnit, but it's
> too slow. Any tips for increasing speed? Here is a sample EJB tets case..."?
>
> If you really don't know how to do X, try searching the web first. Try
> searching this list's archives next. If that does not get you going, then by
> all means, ask a specific, pointed question.
>
> Please, folks! I don't want to start ignoring this list because its readers
> show no initiative.
>
> JBR.
>
